metadata.title: CVE-2022-1720 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Buffer Over-read in function grab_file_name in GitHub repository vim/vimprior to 8.2.4956. This vulnerability is capable of crashing the software,memory modification, and possible remote execution.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1720` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

vim - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5.13
vim-athena - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5.13
vim-common - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5.13
vim-gtk - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5.13
vim-gtk3 - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5.13
vim-gui-common - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5.13
vim-nox - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5.13
vim-runtime - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5.13
vim-tiny - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5.13
xxd - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5.13
No subscription required

criterions.comment: vim package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5.13').
